newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore's Hotel Plaza sees better H2.
newsitem.headline: Singapore's Hotel Plaza sees better H2.

text.p: Hotel Plaza Ltd said on Thursday it expected its results for the second half of 1996 to be "better than for the previous year".

In a statement accompanying its first half results, the company said: "Competition in the hotel industry in Singapore is expected to remain keen with 10 new hotels having opened or due to open in 1996 thereby increasing the total number of rooms available by seven percent to 29,669."
Hotel Plaza, a unit of property developer United Overseas Land Ltd, earlier announced a 115 percent rise in net profit for the six months ended June 30, 1996.
The company said the outlook for the hotel industry in Australia was positive. "The group's hotels there are enjoying improved occupancy and room rates," it said.
